Articles.Content:
So, a while back, I was looking at a bunch of parodies of "The Final Countdown" and I looked to see if anyone had made a KSP version. There weren't any (that I could find) so I decided to try my hand at making one. I made the first part of it about a month ago, and I made the rest over the course of three days. i finished it a few days ago. I hope you like it!

Link: Here

Edited April 21, 2016 by Ultimate Steve
I can't put my finger on why, but this video makes me grin like a happy little idiot and makes me want to launch something powerfully stupid.  Thanks for sharing it with us.

You're welcome

*goes off to VAB and starts to build a giant rocket made of clustered mammoths, while grinning like a happy idiot*

That quote will live on forever!

EDIT: Do you mind it I quote you in my signature?

Edited April 8, 2016 by Ultimate Steve
Requesting Permission for use of quotation
No, of course not.  Be my guest.

I am not ashamed to admit I Goosebumps at the beginning buildup!

This is just way too fun!!!!  And the ending... well... not going to spoil it...  just loved it!!!!   

Now I want to make a music video!!!

It's the final awesomeness!!! 

BTW, The destroyed VAB reminds me of your sig @Just Jim!
Thanks, to you all! It was fun to make, and I'm thinking of doing another music video sometime, I'm just not sure which song I would do.
Outstanding! Would love to know the stories behind some of those crashes

1 hour ago, Kuzzter said:

Outstanding! Would love to know the stories behind some of those crashes  

*Comes home to find that Kuzzter has replied to my thread*    *Faints from excitemet*

Thanks for the compliment! I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed it! Most of the explosions were "on purpose" but I wasn't expecting my Jool Scansat to bounce twice on Pol before exploding. The crash of my plane into the VAB wasn't on purpose, I was trying to be a stunt master  and failed (sorta). I did land my Duna lander right the first time, but I tried to fly it a bit closer to the dome (and then crashed it). The explosions you hear after I plant the flag was debris crashing behind the camera (). In case you are wondering, both the dome and the lander were HyperEdited to Duna, as well as 90% of the stuff outside of Kerbin's SOI. However, all of the stuff inside Kerbin's SOI was built legit, and some of it in career mode.

Glad you enjoyed!

On April 9, 2016 at 11:37 PM, Ultimate Steve said:

Thanks, to you all! It was fun to make, and I'm thinking of doing another music video sometime, I'm just not sure which song I would do.

Across the universe?

Aaaaaand, now Sony has taken it down because of copyright. Nothing I can do about that. But why would they take down my video with <100 views that gives as much credit to the band as possible when there are videos out there with thousands of views that claim the song as their own?

11 minutes ago, Ultimate Steve said:

Aaaaaand, now Sony has taken it down because of copyright. Nothing I can do about that. But why would they take down my video with <100 views that gives as much credit to the band as possible when there are videos out there with thousands of views that claim the song as their own?

I think it's the youtube bot which analyse videos ..

Maybe try on dailymotion
I wondered why the video was set to private....

*comes back and checks youtube video for no reason*

Hey, now it's only blocked in Canada and Germany! (Yes, I know, a lot of you live in Canada, but It's better than it being blocked in 15 countries)

I turned my video to unlisted, so you need the link to watch it, but at least most of you can watch it now!

Hopefully it stays that way!
